description: The literature has little to offer regarding this stop. Audsley describes its �probable tonality� as �an octave or 4 ft. lingual stop of soft intonation.� Elsewhere he states that the prefix klein, meaning �small�, is used by German builders �to indicate either octave pitch or small scale�. Wedgwood says only �4 ft. Octave Regal.�
examplesDescription: Kleinregal 16'; St. Dominicus, Prague, Czechoslovakia. This example is cited by Adlung.
